Providing a collaborative research environment together with universities and other academic partners in Japan and abroad, HRI is engaged in frontier research, including exploring new technological fields, with a focus on next-generation AI. Canada-Japan Co-op Student job description/responsibilities Research & Development Co-op Student (automatic speech recognition system) The project will investigate relevant modules required to build an automatic speech recognition system. Topics to be addressed will be end-to-end neural training, speech translation, or speech recognition. Specifically, a successful co-op student will use the ESPnet toolkit to improve, train, and evaluate deep learning models. In addition, the student will write a paper based on the results obtained. Canada-Japan Co-op Student required skills, qualifications Required: - Strong fundamental skills and knowledge in deep learning techniques (e.g. CNN, LSTM, Transformer). - Knowledge and experience in applications of deep learning techniques for speech processing (e.g. automatic speech recognition, speech translation, speaker diarization, speech enhancement, speech separation, etc.) - Programming skills in Python and open-source deep learning libraries (Pytorch, ESPnet, Kaldi, git, etc.). - Strong written and verbal communication skills in English - Highly motivated individual - Willingness to learn Japanese language and culture Work location Wako city, Saitama Dormitory accommodation A company-subsidized furnished apartment will be provided upon your arrival Distance between dormitory and place of work 10 minutes on foot Monthly student salary 150,000 JPY/Month after tax deductions Airfare coverage Full coverage Application Deadline: 4:00pm on Wednesday, Oct 11, 2023 (PDT) *Please be advised that this position is through The Canada-Japan Co-op Program, all new co-op students are advised to review the Student Information Presentation first and to complete the online Student Application form www.thecoopjapanprogram.com by the application deadline. Canada-Japan Co-op Student job description/responsibilities Research & Development Co-op Student (computational models for intelligent agents -modeling) A successful co-op student will implement and evaluate computational models that define the behavior of intelligent agents. Tasks will include investigating and implementing mathematical theories, developing experimental programs, conducting experiments, data analysis, and visualization. For evaluation, the student will conduct cognitive behavioral experiments with human participants. Writing explanatory documents and research reports on the developed programs is also part of the internship. This position will be focused mainly on the modeling part. The student is expected to participate proactively and voluntarily in all project phases. Canada-Japan Co-op Student required skills, qualifications Required Skills: • Adequate knowledge of mathematics and computer science • Strong interest in human cognition and human-machine interaction • Experience and strong programming skills in Python, Julia, R, C#, other programming languages • Strong organizational skills and time management skills • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English • Highly motivated individual • Enthusiastic and passionate about science and engineering • Knowledge of cognitive science, neuroscience, or experimental psychology would be helpful • Japanese language is not required at work but basic conversational Japanese would be helpful to live in Japan Work location Wako-city, Saitama Dormitory accommodation A company-subsidized furnished apartment will be provided upon your arrival. Canada-Japan Co-op Student job description/responsibilities Research & Development Co-op Student (Innovation with the tabletop robot) Join us as a motivated Social Robot Engineer to drive innovation with the Haru robot, an engaging tabletop companion. Depending on your experiences and skills you could work on: - Defining Social Features: Collaborate on defining diverse low-, mid- and high- level social attributes, such gaze to engagement, enhancing group dynamics. - Development of Cutting-edge Software: Create software capturing low-level features, including gaze and gestures, utilizing existing apps and novel techniques. - Machine Learning: Employ machine learning to fuse low to high-level features, enriching Haru's interactive abilities Canada-Japan Co-op Student required skills, qualifications Only for Master’s co-op students Required: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Robotics or Artificial Intelligence, with - background in computer vision and/or machine learning - Programming experience using Python or C++ Preferred: - past experience in robotics systems, including familiarity with robot hardware, sensors, and actuators. - Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques, particularly for feature extraction and fusion. - Version control (GIT) - Robotics Operating System (ROS) experience Work location Wako-city, Saitama Dormitory accommodation A company-subsidized furnished apartment will be provided upon your arrival Distance between dormitory and place of work 10 minutes on foot Monthly student salary 150,000 JPY/Month after tax deductions Airfare coverage Full coverage Application Deadline: 4:00pm on Wednesday, Oct 11, 2023 (PDT) *Please be advised that this position is through The Canada-Japan Co-op Program, all new co-op students are advised to review the Student Information Presentation first and to complete the online Student Application form www.thecoopjapanprogram.com by the application deadline.
